title: The electoral map just keeps getting worse for Trump
description: It's easy to get lost in the sea of national polls -- all of which show former Vice President Joe Biden with high-single digit lead over President Donald Trump.

title: Covid-19 has brought US 'to its knees': CDC chief
description: Covid-19 has "brought this nation to its knees," Dr. Robert Redfield, director of the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, said Tuesday.

title: Baffled by some Americans' resistance to masks? Read this
description: America was born in rebellion and it's a spirit that still runs deep in its character.

title: Top Pentagon nominee spread conspiracy that former CIA director tried to overthrow Trump
description: The White House's nominee for a top Pentagon post repeatedly spread conspiracy theories that a former CIA director tried to overthrow President Donald Trump and even have him assassinated in newly discovered comments from radio and television appearances as well as on social media.

title: Barcelona opera reopens with concert for 2000+ plants
description: To mark Spain's lifting of lockdown restrictions, an opera house in Barcelona reopened with a performance in front of an audience of 2,292 potted plants.

title: Saharan dust plume darkening skies in Caribbean is heading to the US
description: The current Saharan dust episode is leading to the worst dust storm in the Caribbean in decades.

title: 80% of this village has Covid-19. The nearest hospital is an 8-hour boat ride away
How major cities are transforming transportation
description: CNN's Nic Robertson reports on how major cities, like London, are adjusting their transportation methods to create safer environments for pedestrians and cyclists amid the coronavirus pandemic.

title: A restaurant turned away a Black boy for his clothes, but allowed a similarly dressed White boy
description: A Baltimore restaurant group has apologized after a video showed a Black woman and her son being denied service because the boy's clothes didn't fit the restaurant's dress code, even though a White boy, dressed similarly, was seemingly allowed to dine there.

title: Novak Djokovic after Covid-19 diagnosis: 'We were wrong and it was too soon'
description: Novak Djokovic has tested positive for coronavirus following an exhibition event he organized in Croatia.

title: 'Mind-blowing': See what happened after Trump officials tried to clean up remarks
description: Trump administration and campaign officials, who have been trying to clean up the President's comments about slowing coronavirus testing, were contradicted by President Trump himself.

title: Surge in illegal fireworks usage keep residents on edge
description: Authorities in New York and other major cities are trying to understand why the use of illegal fireworks is spiking ahead of the Fourth of July holiday.

title: Dr. Fauci gets upset with lawmaker's question
description: Dr. Anthony Fauci gave a fiery response to Rep. David McKinley (R-WV) when asked about discouraging people from wearing masks early in the Covid-19 pandemic.

title: The most succinct -- and brutal -- Republican rejection of Trump you will ever read
description: For all of the words that have been written and spoken about -- and by -- Donald Trump, it's often difficult to put a finger on what makes his presidency so incredibly abnormal.

title: Charlize Theron denies she was engaged to Sean Penn
description: There was a whole bunch of excitement back in 2014 when people thought Charlize Theron was engaged to Sean Penn.

title: Escape to San Francisco through these films
description: The city by the bay is the backdrop to some amazing movies

title: Covid-19 returns to countries that had a grip on it
description: • UK PM unveils major lockdown relaxation

title: Opera house reopens with performance to 2,292 plants
description: It's not uncommon for performances at Barcelona's Gran Teatre del Liceu opera house to be sold out, but musicians played to an unusual audience on Monday to mark Spain's lifting of lockdown -- as thousands of plants filled its seats.

title: Prison officers were barred from Derek Chauvin's floor because of their skin color
description: Eight corrections officers at the Ramsey County, Minnesota, jail where former Minneapolis Police Officer Derek Chauvin is being held say they were briefly barred from the floor where he was held the day he was booked into the jail because of the color of their skin, according to discrimination charges filed with the Minnesota Department of Human Rights.

title: Some public health officials are resigning after threats
Indian religious festival goes ahead as coronavirus cases surge
description: Hundreds of devotees are expected to participate in one of India's most celebrated religious processions Tuesday, after the country's highest court ruled that the annual spectacle could go ahead in a limited capacity despite the high coronavirus risk.

title: 'Embarrassed': 'White Lives Matter' banner flown over Premier League game
description: Burnley has strongly condemned a "White Lives Matter Burnley" banner that was flown by a small plane over the Etihad Stadium ahead of their English Premier League match against Manchester City on Monday.

title: Public restrooms: What you need to know about using them safely amid the pandemic
description: When Mariel Balaban drove across the United States in the middle of the pandemic, she knew that avoiding public restrooms was not an option for her young family.

title: What happened when luxury hotels swapped tourists for medical workers
description: To say the Covid-19 pandemic has had a significant impact on the hotel industry is something of an understatement.

title: New Zealand's lost underwater continent revealed
description: Under New Zealand, there lies a vast continent on the sea floor.

title: Tech companies slam Trump's executive order restricting work visas
description: • Trump extends restrictions on work visas

title: Sheriff's and DA's office employees accused of vandalizing Black Lives Matter sign
description: Employees from a Southern California sheriff's and district attorney's office were among three people who were arrested after multiple people were caught on a security camera vandalizing a Black Lives Matter sign, authorities said.

title: Secret Service tells press to leave White House grounds in highly unusual move
description: The US Secret Service on Monday evening told members of the White House press corps to immediately leave the White House grounds.

title: Trump pays price for pandemic denial
description: • Analysis: White House struggles to offer consistent message on range of major topics

title: California college professor on leave after asking student to 'Anglicize' name
description: A professor from Laney College in Oakland has been placed on administrative leave after asking a student to "Anglicize" her name.

title: MLB aims to play 60 games in 2020, source says
description: Major League Baseball announced Monday that clubs have unanimously voted to proceed with the 2020 season under the terms of their agreement with the MLB Players Association from March.

title: Doctor: I've been told to 'go back to my own country'
description: Dr. Leana Wen says she has received backlash over her ethnicity after appearing on air to discuss the coronavirus pandemic. She shared her experience following President Donald Trump's Tulsa rally, in which he used a racist term to refer to coronavirus.

title: NYPD officer in 'apparent chokehold incident' had previous civilian complaint cases
description: The New York police officer who appeared to put a man into a chokehold on video has had previous complaints against him involving use of force, according to records provided to CNN by the city's Civilian Complaint Review Board.

title: Trump moves quickly to calm worries over China trade deal after adviser's comments
description: President Donald Trump moved quickly to try and calm stock market worries after top China trade adviser Peter Navarro cast doubt over the future of his hard-fought trade deal with Beijing.

title: Some public health officials are resigning after threats
description: During a live public briefing on Facebook last month, "someone very casually suggested" the Los Angeles County's public health director should be shot, the director said.

title: Pompeo urges China to release two detained Canadians after 'groundless' charges
description: The United States has spoken out forcefully against China's prosecution of two Canadian men for spying.

title: 'I'm on a mission to empower India's transgender community'
description: I remember my childhood so vividly. Until the age of 11, I was a playful, happy child at home, and a good student at school.

title: US designates 4 more Chinese media organizations as foreign diplomatic missions
description: The Trump administration announced that it will designate four more Chinese media organizations as foreign diplomatic missions, arguing that they are under the control of the Chinese Communist Party.

title: This is who's blocked from coming to the US under Trump's latest ban
description: President Trump's latest proclamation outlines a number of new restrictions on visas for temporary foreign workers.

title: Trump falsely accuses Obama of treason in latest unfounded attack on his predecessor
description: President Donald Trump has falsely accused former President Barack Obama of committing treason in his latest unfounded accusation aimed at his predecessor.

title: Anderson Cooper responds to White House press secretary's defense of Trump
description: CNN's Anderson Cooper calls out President Donald Trump for comments he made about the coronavirus at his rally in Tulsa, Oklahoma, and White House press secretary Kayleigh McEnany for trying to spin it as a joke.

title: White House admits Trump was involved in firing of top US attorney after Trump claimed he wasn't
description: The White House on Monday admitted that President Donald Trump was involved in the removal of US Attorney Geoffrey Berman after Trump had claimed he was "not involved" in the process this weekend.
